name: Kids Help Phone
description: Canada's only 24/7, national support service. Professional counselling, information, and referrals for young people in English and French.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: All youth (5-29) in Canada. Mental health support. Exclusion: None (24/7 anonymous).
access_script: Hi, I'm feeling really overwhelmed right now and just need someone to talk to. Is this a safe place to share?

name: Trans Lifeline
description: Grassroots hotline offering direct emotional and financial support to trans people in crisis. Operated by trans people for trans people.
synthetic_queries: Coming out advice from trans person
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Trans, non-binary, and questioning individuals. Peer support. Exclusion: Cisgender individuals seeking info (refer to allies line).
access_script: Hi, I'm trans and I'm really struggling with dysphoria today. Can I talk to someone who understands?

name: Hope for Wellness Helpline
description: Immediate mental health counselling and crisis intervention for all Indigenous peoples across Canada. Available 24/7.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: First Nations, Inuit, and MÃ©tis peoples across Canada. Culturally competent counselling.
access_script: Hi, I am an Indigenous student and I'm having a hard time. I'd like to speak with a culturally safe counsellor.

name: Assaulted Women's Helpline
description: 24-hour telephone and TTY crisis line for all women in Ontario who have experienced any form of abuse.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Women in Ontario experiencing abuse/violence. Exclusion: Men (refer to other lines).
access_script: Hello, I am in an unsafe situation at home and I need to know my options for leaving.

name: Immigrant Services Kingston & Area (ISKA)
description: Settlement services for immigrants and refugees. Assistance with housing, employment, language, and community connection.
address: 837 Princess St, Unit 201, Kingston, ON K7L 1G9
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Newcomers, immigrants, refugees in KFL&A. Settlement support. Exclusion: None.
access_script: Hi, I'm new to Kingston and looking for help with settlement and housing. Do I need an appointment?

name: Trellis HIV & Community Care
description: Support for individuals affected by HIV/AIDS and STBBIs. Harm reduction supplies, education, and stigma-free support.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Open to all. Focus on HIV/STBBI and substance use. Exclusion: None.
access_script: Hi, I'd like to pick up some harm reduction supplies. Do I need an appointment or can I just drop in?

name: One Roof Kingston Youth Hub
description: One-stop access to housing, mental health, addiction, and employment services for youth (16-24). Drop-in centre available.
synthetic_queries: Mental health help for young adults
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Youth 16-24. Housing, employment, mental health. Drop-in available. Exclusion: Adults 25+.
access_script: Hi, I'm 20 and having a hard time finding a job and a place to live. Can I drop by to see a worker?

name: Victim Services of Kingston and Frontenac
description: 24/7 crisis response and practical assistance for victims of crime and tragic circumstances. VQRP+ funding helper.
synthetic_queries: Police referred me to victim services
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Victims of crime/tragedy in Frontenac. Exclusion: Non-victims.
access_script: Hi, I was recently a victim of a crime and the police mentioned I could call you for support. What kind of help do you offer?

name: Yellow House Centre for Equity & Inclusion
description: Safe, accountable, and empowering space for QTBIPoC (Queer, Trans, Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour) students.
address: 207 Stuart St (Rideau Building), 3rd Floor, Kingston, ON K7L 3N6
synthetic_queries: Safe space for people of colour
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: QTBIPoC Queen's students. Safe space & community building. Exclusion: Non-Queen's (though likely welcoming).
access_script: Hi, I'm a first-year student looking to connect with other QTBIPoC students. When is the best time to drop by?

name: Queen's Human Rights & Equity Office
description: Receives and investigates complaints of harassment, discrimination, and hate crimes on campus. Provides advice on human rights.
address: Mackintosh-Corry Hall, Room B506, Kingston, ON K7L 3N6
synthetic_queries: Professor was racist what do I do
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Queen's community (students, staff, faculty). Discrimination/Harassment issues. Exclusion: General legal disputes.
access_script: Hi, I experienced an incident on campus that felt discriminatory and I'd like to talk to an advisor about it.

name: Sexual Violence Prevention & Response Coordinator (SVPRC)
description: Confidential, non-judgmental support for students impacted by sexual violence. Assistance with academic accommodations and reporting options.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Queen's students impacted by sexual violence. Exclusion: Non-Queen's community (refer to SAC Kingston).
access_script: Hi, I experienced an incident recently and I'd like to understand my options for reporting and academic considerations.

name: AMS Peer Support Centre (PSC)
description: Student-run listening service offering non-judgmental peer support. Drop-in or appointment. (Located in JDUC Room 430).
address: JDUC Room 430, 99 University Ave, Kingston, ON K7L 3N6
synthetic_queries: Need someone to talk to student
Talk to another student active listening
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Queen's students. Peer-based active listening. Exclusion: Crisis intervention (Refer to crisis lines).
access_script: Hi, I'm feeling pretty lonely lately and just wanted to chat with someone who gets the student life.

name: Hotel Dieu Hospital Urgent Care Centre
description: Urgent care for non-life-threatening injuries and illnesses (e.g., cuts, burns, broken bones). Open daily.
synthetic_queries: See a doctor today not emergency
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Non-life-threatening urgent issues (cuts, breaks). Exclusion: Critical trauma (Go to KGH). Note: Registration closes when capacity reached.
access_script: Hi, I think I have a minor bone break. Are you still accepting patients for today, or is capacity reached?

name: Kingston General Hospital (KGH) Emergency
description: 24/7 Emergency Department for life-threatening conditions, trauma, and critical care.
address: 41 King Street West, Kingston, ON K7L 2V7
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Life-threatening injuries, trauma, critical care. Exclusion: Minor ailments (Go to Urgent Care/Walk-in).
access_script: Hi, I'm bringing in a friend who is having severe chest pain. Where is the best place to drop them off?

name: KFL&A Public Health Dental Services
description: Dental care for eligible low-income children and seniors, and emergency dental for social assistance recipients.
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Low-income (HSO/OSDCP) or adults on OW/ODSP with emergency. Exclusion: General public without coverage.

name: Kingston Community Legal Clinic
description: Free legal advice and representation for low-income residents regarding housing, income assistance (OW/ODSP), and tenants rights.

provenance.method: Web Search & Verification of Law Focus

eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Low-income Kingston residents. Housing, OW/ODSP, Employment law. Exclusion: Criminal/Family law (Refer to Legal Aid).

name: Salvation Army Housing Help Centre
description: Housing listings, eviction prevention grants, and support for those at risk of homelessness. (Formerly Housing Resource Centre).
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: At risk of homelessness or low-income. Rent/Utility arrears. Exclusion: Must meet income cap for grants.

name: Queen's Off-Campus Living Advisor (OCLA)
description: Confidential guidance for Queen's students on landlord disputes, lease reviews, and tenant rights.
synthetic_queries: Review my lease before I sign
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Queen's students living off-campus. Lease reviews, landlord disputes. Exclusion: Formal legal representation in court.

name: KCHC Transgender Health Care
description: Specialized primary care and hormone therapy initiation for transgender and gender-diverse individuals (Age 12+).
eligibility_notes: Inclusion: Trans/Gender-diverse individuals (12+). Self-referral accepted. Exclusion: None stated.

name: Street Health Centre
description: Barrier-free primary care, addiction services, and harm reduction for vulnerable populations. Needle exchange and opioid treatment available.
